modules.description: This module provides server-side RPC services for interacting with the OCurrent Engine by exposing Cap'n Proto interfaces for job and engine operations. It works with `Current.Engine.t` and handles job services through `Current_rpc.Job.t` and `Current_rpc.Engine.t`. Concrete use cases include enabling remote clients to query build statuses and trigger jobs via the Cap'n Proto RPC protocol.

This module provides functions to interact with remote job services, enabling clients to retrieve job logs, cancel or rebuild jobs, and check or update job status. It works with job capabilities, status records containing job metadata, and string-based job identifiers. Concrete use cases include streaming log output from a running job, requesting job cancellation or rebuilds, and checking whether a job can be canceled or rebuilt.

This module provides operations to interact with an engine service, specifically listing active jobs and retrieving job details by ID. It works with job identifiers and job capabilities, enabling clients to query the status and metadata of pipeline jobs. Concrete use cases include monitoring ongoing pipeline activity and inspecting specific job results, even if they are no longer active.

This module implements remote procedure call (RPC) functionality for interacting with job and engine services. It provides operations to stream job logs, cancel or rebuild jobs, list active jobs, retrieve job details, and expose Cap'n Proto interfaces for remote clients. The module works with job identifiers, capabilities, status records, and engine services to support use cases like monitoring pipelines, inspecting job results, and triggering remote job actions.
